etymology.description: 迪化 (old ROC name of Ürümqi) + 街 (street) = Dihua Street.
etymology.interpretation: Formed by a toponym plus the generic street suffix, a common naming pattern in Taipei. 迪化 reflects ROC-era practice of using mainland place names for streets after 1945.

parts.english: Dihua (ROC-era name of Ürümqi); to enlighten; to transform (archaic)

examples.chinese: 我们在台北的迪化街买年货(我們在臺北的迪化街買年貨)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen zài Táiběi de Díhuà Jiē mǎi niánhuò.
examples.english: We buy New Year goods on Dihua Street in Taipei.

examples.chinese: 迪化街保留了许多古老的店屋(迪化街保留了許多古老的店屋)。
examples.pinyin: Díhuà Jiē bǎoliú le xǔduō gǔlǎo de diànwū.
examples.english: Dihua Street preserves many old shophouses.

examples.chinese: 每到过年前，这里都非常热闹(每到過年前，這裡都非常熱鬧)。
examples.pinyin: Měi dào guònián qián, zhèlǐ dōu fēicháng rènào.
examples.english: Before Lunar New Year, it gets very lively here.
